result.execSummary:
The defendant Elbert John Hughes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
CONCURRENT with revocation sentences in 04CF5841 and 07CF6165 and CONSECUTIVE to Count 2 in 14CF3483 (Sentence credit to be determined).
Defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor. Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Signed and filed on 4-26-16: Decision and Order Partially Granting Motion to Amend JOC.

THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the defendant is granted 156 days of sentence credit count one in 14CF003483.

*copy to defense counsel and district attorney*
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Michelle Ackerman Havas, Br. 45, calendar successor, for review. mag
Motion to Amend Judgment of Conviction received and filed.

Defendant Elbert John Hughes in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Defendant Elbert John Hughes in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Court makes finding that the defendant is a REPEATER.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Clarifications were made as to content of PSI.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   
For purposes of the jury trial/verdict form the court had designated this case as COUNT 4.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to count 2 in 14CF3483.  CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS with the following conditions as to each count:  Court ordered sentence to be served concurrent with revocation sentences in 04CF5841 and 07CF6165. (Defense counsel to provide information as to date of arrest and date of revocation for sentence credit to be determined.)
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-No contact with Jodie A.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded.
Filed:
Notice of Intent to Seek Postconviction Relief; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Ineligible Voting Acknowledgment
Verdict form, received and filed.
Jury instructions, received and filed.
Exhibit list, received and filed.

Defendant Elbert John Hughes in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Defendant Elbert John Hughes in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

At the hour of 10:01 a.m. jury back in box.

Court continues instructing jury.  

Closing arguments by state and defense. Rebuttal argument by the state.

Court charged the jury.  

Alternate juror selected by lot (19) and released.  

Jury retired at the hour of 11:02 to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Spottek and Meilke who were duly sworn for that purpose.  

Discussions regarding which exhibits will be given to the jurors placed on the record. 

Juror question at the hour of 11:25. 

Court directs counsels to agree on exhibits.

At the hour of 11:50 jury was dismissed and ordered to return at the hour of 1:10. Jurors returned to resume deliberations at 1:10.

Discussions regarding jury questions placed on the record.

Juror question at the hour of 2:29.

Discussions regarding jury questions placed on the record. 

At the hour of 3:35 the jury returned and, by their foreperson (#14), brought in verdicts of:
Count 1: Battery - Guilty
Count 2: False Imprisonment - Guilty
Count 3: Threats to Injure or Accuse of Crime - Not Guilty
Count 4: Intimidation of a Witness - Guilty (This count is 15CF712, but captioned as Count 4 solely for purposes of jury)

Which was then read.  Court polled jury and discharged them from service. State motion for judgment on verdicts is granted. Court enters judgment of conviction as to Counts 1,2 & 4 and judgment of acquittal as to Count 3. Verdicts received and filed. Case is adjourned for sentencing on 3/4/2016 at 8:15 a.m. in Branch 38. Court orders PSI and remands defendant. Exhibit list filed. Jury Instructions filed. Defendant at KMCI-OTP to be completed.

Defendant Elbert John Hughes in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Defendant Elbert John Hughes in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

At the hour of 1:11 jury back in box.

Previously sworn for the state:  West Milwaukee Police Officer Michelle Rhode.

Exhibit 31 received.

Sworn for the state: Milwaukee County District Attorney Investigator Todd Armstrong.

Exhibits 32, 33 & 36 received.

State rests subject to rebuttal.  

Jury out of box at the hour of 2:14.  

Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  

Discussions regarding defendant's testimony placed on the record. Colloquy between court and defendant as to his decision to testify in this matter.

Jury back in the box at the hour of 2:29.  

Sworn for defense: Elbert H.  

Defense rests.  

Jury out of box at the hour of 3:25.

Discussions regarding jury instructions placed on the record and agreed to by counsels.

Jury back in the box at the hour of 3:44

Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: West Milwaukee Police Officer Michelle Rhode.

State and defense rest. 

Testimony closed.  

Court begins instructions to jury.  

At the hour of 4:15 p.m. Jury was dismissed for the evening but ordered to return on 1/27/2016 at 9:30 a.m.  Jury out of box.

Defendant Elbert John Hughes in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Defendant Elbert John Hughes in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense places questions regarding "other acts" on the record. Defense requests a ruling on the questions being asked. State objects. State will not introduce "other acts". 

At the hour of 9:32 jury back in box.

Opening statements by state and defense.  

Trial proceeded.  

Sworn for the state:  Jodie A.

Exhibits 1-19 received.  

Jury out of the box at the hour of 10:25

Jury back in box at the hour of 10:50

Sworn for the state: Wisconsin State Crime Lab Finger Print Analyst Lisa Gordee

Exhibit 20 received.

Sworn for the state: West Milwaukee Police Officer Kevin Eade

Exhibits 21-29 received.

Sworn for the state: West Milwaukee Police Officer Michelle Rhode

At the hour of 11:54 p.m. Jury was dismissed but ordered to return at 1:10 p.m.  Jury out of box.

Defendant Elbert John Hughes in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Defendant Elbert John Hughes in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pre-trial discussions placed on the record. Negotiations placed on the record.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:02 p.m.   

Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  

Jury list received and filed. 

Jury out of box at the hour of 3:00 p.m.

Jury back in the box at the hour of 3:10 p.m.

Court instructed jury.  

At the hour of 3:30 p.m. Jury was dismissed for the evening but ordered to return on 1/26/2016 at 9:00 a.m.  Jury out of box.

Defendant Elbert John Hughes in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Defendant Elbert John Hughes in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for motion hearing.  Court will address Motion to Admit Statements Under the Doctrine of Forfeiture by Wrongdoing at the jury trial date. Case remains calendared for jury trial on 1/25/2016 at 8:15 a.m. in Branch 38.

Atty Rider appears today for MOTION HEARING.  ADA Sarah McNutt appears for ADA Nicolas Heitman.  Motion is not calendared and defendant was not produced from DCI.  CCAP entry from 12-21-2015 does not indicate that motion hearing was adjourned to today.  Clerk checked with court reporter of 12-21-2015 and in fact a discussion was held and motion was adjourned to 1-7-2016.  The court will hearing motion on 1-19-2016 at 8:15; OTP to be completed by state.

Attorney Andrew R Rider in court.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not appear, counsel waives his appearance.  Motion hearing unable to proceed.  Motion to be heard on day of trial.
